Cengage Magma

00Introduction

The goal of Magma is to build a design language that transcends Cengage Learning products and platforms to provide a consistent, usable, high quality, modern user experience on any device.

You can also view the Magma Framework Documentation for help using Magma in your project

01Colors

Primary Colors

The primary color palette represents the dominant colors to be used against a light grey or white background

  • HEX #3f3f3f
  • CR 10.5:1
  • $primary01
  • HEX #007db8
  • CR 10.5:1
  • $primary02
  • HEX #f7f7f7
  • CR 10.5:1
  • $primary03
  • HEX #ffffff
  • CR 10.5:1
  • $primary04

Secondary Colors

Use the secondary color palette as complimentary shades of the primary color palette

  • HEX #063961
  • CR 11.9:1
  • $secondary01
  • HEX #2e9cd4
  • CR 3.1:1
  • $secondary02
  • HEX #575757
  • CR 7.2:1
  • $secondary03
  • HEX #7a7a7a
  • CR 4.3:1
  • $secondary04
  • HEX #bfbfbf
  • 1.8:1
  • $secondary05
  • HEX #dfdfdf
  • CR 1.3:1
  • $secondary06

Accent Colors

Use the accent color palette to draw attention, add contrast and create visual interest

  • HEX #6f9823
  • CR 3.4:1
  • $accent01
  • HEX #90b82e
  • CR 2.3:1
  • $accent02
  • HEX #9bca43
  • CR 1.9:1
  • $accent03
  • HEX #c1510a
  • CR 4.7:1
  • $accent04
  • HEX #fa6600
  • 3.1:1
  • $accent05
  • HEX #f2981d
  • CR 2.3:1
  • $accent06

Limited Colors

The limited color palette is reserved for very specific uses and is not considered a core part of the overall scheme

  • HEX #ef0000
  • CR 4.5:1
  • $limited01
  • HEX #ff5858
  • CR 3.1:1
  • $limited02
  • HEX #ececec
  • CR 7.9:1
  • $limited03

02Typography

Titles & Headings

  • heading 1

  • heading 2

  • heading 3

  • heading 4

  • heading 5
  • heading 6

  • heading 1

  • heading 2

  • heading 3

  • heading 4

  • heading 5
  • heading 6
  • Do Use correct colors for bold typography
  • Do Use tall caps font for short headlines

  • heading 1

  • heading 2

  • heading 3

  • heading 4

  • heading 5
  • heading 6
  • Do Use correct colors for bold typography
  • Do Use tall caps font for short headlines
  • Don't Use incorrect colors or colors with too little contrast
  • Don't Use tall caps font for body copy or long headlines

Text

Body copy is always Open Sans Regular 15px with 22px of line height in Gray #3f3f3f.

Bold Italic Text Link

  • Unordered list
  • Unordered list
  1. Ordered list
  2. Ordered list

Do Use an appropriate mixture of uppercase titles and lowercase copy throughout a design to add subtle variations in typography.

Don't USE ALL UPPERCASE FOR EXTREMELY LONG HEADINGS OR AS BODY COPY.

Narrative Text

Narrative copy is used when there is a longer passage of reading in the content such as in the reader. Narrative copy uses Cordale starting at 18px with 34px of line height in Gray #3f3f3f.

Bold Italic Text Link

  • Unordered list
  • Unordered list
  1. Ordered list
  2. Ordered list

Do Use the narrative font for any copy that is part of the content and is longer and a few sentences.

Usage

For details on using these fonts please see the framework documentation on typography

03Buttons

Styling

Default Button States

Dropdown Buttons

Option 1 Option 2 Option 3
Extremely long optio…

Icon Buttons

Disabled Buttons

Learn the Rules

Do Create buttons with a 3px border radius and ensure enough padding within the button.

Don't Use a larger/smaller border radius or too much/little padding.

04Forms

Default

Forget?

Focused

Forget?

Error

Forget?

Additional Form Elements

Radio Label
Radio Label
Radio Label Required
Checkbox Label Required

Do Use informative labels & placeholders illustrating the information requested.

Do Clearly indicate where the focus is set.

Do Give concise, informative and instant feedback when possible.

Don't Show internal or un-informative error messages.

Don't Wait for a submission to "soft" validate fields.

Don't Require trivial or un-necessary information.

05Texture & Shadow

Texture

The Magma texture is used as a background image when a clear separation of content is intended, but a bold background color is not desired. The slight texture adds a sense of feeling that balances the bold solid colors.

Shadow

Shadows exists to compliment texture giving the perception of depth to an otherwise flat landscape.

Shadows are always subtle and cannot be underused.

Do Small subtle shadows
Don't Deep black shadows

06UI Elements

Graphs

User Icons

Large - 100px
Medium - 70px
Small - 40px

Standalone Alerts

Error You need to correct this error.
Notification You should be aware of this.
Success You did something correctly.
Friendly This isn't too important.

Magma Icon Font
